title: ما هو أطول برج في العالم
What is the difference between '==' and '==='?
What is a closure in JavaScript?
answer1: A block of code that executes independently
answer2: A function along with its lexical environment
answer4: A function that doesn't return a value
right_answer: A function along with its lexical environment

title: What is hoisting in JavaScript?
answer1: Moving all variables to the top of the code
answer2: Moving functions to the bottom of the code
answer3: Default behavior of moving declarations to the top
right_answer: Default behavior of moving declarations to the top

title: What is the difference between 'var', 'let', and 'const'?
answer1: 'var' has function scope, 'let' and 'const' have block scope
answer4: 'let' is global scope, 'var' is block scope
right_answer: 'var' has function scope, 'let' and 'const' have block scope

title: What is the purpose of JavaScript promises?
What is the purpose of the 'map' method in JavaScript?
answer1: To create a new array by applying a function to each element
answer2: To filter elements from an array
answer3: To sort the elements of an array
answer4: To reduce an array into a single value
right_answer: To create a new array by applying a function to each element

title: What is the difference between 'null' and 'undefined'?
What is event delegation?
answer1: Attaching an event to the document object
answer2: Using one event listener for multiple child elements
answer3: Creating multiple event listeners for child elements
right_answer: Using one event listener for multiple child elements

title: What are JavaScript arrow functions?
answer1: Functions that allow a shorter syntax
right_answer: Functions that allow a shorter syntax

title: What is the purpose of 'setTimeout' in JavaScript?
answer1: To execute code at regular intervals
answer2: To execute code after a specified delay
answer3: To stop the execution of code
right_answer: To execute code after a specified delay

title: What is a prototype in JavaScript?
answer2: An object linked to another object
right_answer: An object linked to another object

title: What is the 'fetch' API used for?
What is the purpose of 'async/await' in JavaScript?
What is the 'reduce' method in JavaScript?
answer1: A method to filter elements from an array
answer2: A method to create a new array
answer3: A method to reduce an array into a single value
answer4: A method to sort array elements
right_answer: A method to reduce an array into a single value
